definition: theatrical work (play, opera, TV series etc)/dramatic (change, increase etc)/acute/severe

sentences.english: Chico also was known for performing what was called the comedy of the absurd.
sentences.chinese: Chico也因爲出演被叫做荒誕劇的劇目而出名。

sentences.english: Oh, it's a reserved opera named "The Monkey Creates Havoc in Heaven".
sentences.chinese: 哦，那是一場保留劇目，名叫“大鬧天宮”。

sentences.english: Now Kunqu troupes are trying to grab attention with provocative shows.
sentences.chinese: 現在各崑曲劇團試圖演出有噱頭的劇目來爭取關注。

sentences.english: The first parts concludes the origin and opera features of Wanbang's ture.
sentences.chinese: 第一部分爲宛梆聲腔的來源形成及劇目特色。

sentences.english: She acted with a repertory company for three years.
sentences.chinese: 她在一個輪演劇目劇團裏上演三年。

sentences.english: The application of the montage in the traditional theatrical piece of Liuzi Drama is extensive and colorful.
sentences.chinese: 柳子戲傳統劇目中蒙太奇手法的運用廣泛而多姿。

sentences.english: His comments sneered at the new play.
sentences.chinese: 新上演的劇目受到他嘲笑的評論。

sentences.english: There are books galore, movies in the works, perhaps a Broadway play.
sentences.chinese: 豐富的書籍，電影作品，可能還有百老匯劇目。

sentences.english: Broadway and its plays and theaters, Connegie Hall for the best in the performing arts.
sentences.chinese: 百老匯的劇目，止耐基大廳最優秀的藝術表演。

sentences.english: Let's say you are performing in a play.
sentences.chinese: 假設你在表演一齣劇目。

sentences.english: In addition, result in a private up play one-third of the total.
sentences.chinese: 此外，民營院團參演劇目佔據了總數的三分之一。

sentences.english: No one may produce any TV play whose plan on the subject of TV plays has not been initiated.
sentences.chinese: 未經電視劇題材規劃立項的劇目，不得投拍製作。

sentences.english: "It's nice to have this validation of just how much the sexual repertoire is changing," he said.
sentences.chinese: “很高興確認到底有多少性愛劇目在改變，”他說。

sentences.english: These operas are sung in a popular form of Documentary.
sentences.chinese: 這些劇目都以一種說唱形式的底本流傳。

sentences.english: Well, it lists some shows that will be on next week.
sentences.chinese: 哦，它列出了下週要上演的一些劇目。

definition: to write and direct (a play, film etc)/playwright-director/choreographer-director/scenarist-director
(of a story etc) to unfold/to play out/to develop (a technique etc)/to enact/(logic) to deduce/to infer
